data.title: All 50 Regina Hall Movies (in Order)

data.text:
Get ready to dive into the world of Regina Hall as we present you with our latest movie roundup article. This talented actress has graced both the big and small screens with her phenomenal performances, and we’re excited to take you on a journey through her fascinating filmography.

From romantic comedies to thought-provoking dramas, our article highlights Regina Hall’s diverse career and the movies that have made her the beloved star she is today. Whether you’re a fan of her work or looking to discover her talent, this is the perfect article to keep you entertained and up-to-date with all things Regina Hall.

1. Too Tired to Die (1998)

Too Tired to Die” is a witty and imaginative journey through the life of a young Japanese man named Keith. Filled with fantasy and comedy, this film delves into the depths of what life’s short journey might mean when Death becomes an unexpected companion. When Keith realizes he has only twelve hours left, he faces his mortality head-on, and the unexpected encounters provide laughter, romance, and a dash of the bizarre.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

2. The Best Man (1999)

In 1999, “The Best Man” hit the screens, an enchanting romantic comedy that showcases the life of a Chicago writer. As the story unfolds, the writer finds himself caught in a whirlwind of emotions and chaos when his best friend, who’s about to get married, suspects that his new book’s plot is based on the bride’s passionate past.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

4. Disappearing Acts (2000)

Disappearing Acts” is a riveting drama-romance, released in 2000, featuring a compelling story of a couple’s tumultuous relationship, directed by Gina Prince-Bythewood. Sanaa Lathan and Wesley Snipes star in the lead roles, supported by Michael Imperioli. With a runtime of 1 hour and 55 minutes, it is rated R for mature content. This film, with a plot revolving around a boyfriend-girlfriend relationship, has garnered 9 nominations in various award categories. The movie is part of the African-American cinematic genre and falls under Drama, Romance, and Comedy genres.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

5. Love & Basketball (2000)

Love & Basketball” is a gripping drama, romance, and sports film that follows Monica and Quincy, two talented basketball players who embark on their journey together from childhood to adulthood. The movie highlights the struggles and triumphs they face while navigating their love for the game and each other. Directed by Gina Prince-Bythewood, “Love & Basketball” is a tale of passion, ambition, and the unbreakable bond shared by two individuals who pursue their dreams side by side.

8. Paid in Full (2002)

Paid in Full” is a gripping drama set in the heart of Harlem in the 1980s, where drugs have become an unavoidable part of daily life. A young and ambitious man, desperate to break free from his surroundings, decides to take control of the situation, building a powerful illegal empire. However, as he becomes entangled in the dangerous world of street crime and corruption, his growing sense of guilt forces him to question the morality of his actions.

9. Malibu’s Most Wanted (2003)

Malibu’s Most Wanted” is a hilarious comedy-crime film released in 2003 directed by John Whitesell, featuring an all-star cast including Jamie Kennedy, Ryan O’Neal, and Blair Underwood. The movie revolves around a wealthy, privileged senator who arranges for his son, a young man with dreams of becoming a rapper, to be kidnapped by a pair of black actors pretending to be murderers. The Senator hopes to shock his son into reconsidering his future career choices.

10. 34th NAACP Image Awards (2003)

Step into the world of entertainment and celebration as we dive into the 34th NAACP Image Awards. Set in 2002, the ceremony brought together the best in music, television, and motion pictures to recognize the outstanding achievements of people of color. The show was hosted by the charismatic and hilarious Cedric The Entertainer, who brought his unique charm to every moment.

11. Scary Movie 3 (2003)

In “Scary Movie 3, “ Cindy (Anna Faris), who we met previously in her fearless adventures against terrifying creatures, is entrusted with solving the mystery of ominous crop circles and eerie video tapes. As if that wasn’t enough to keep Cindy on her toes, she’s also asked to aid the President in stopping an extraterrestrial invasion. As Cindy dives headfirst into investigating these strange occurrences, all while surrounded by hilarious moments and outrageous pop culture references, she puts her unyielding comedic wit and bravery to the ultimate test.

13. King’s Ransom (2005)

King’s Ransom is a crime-comedy film that revolves around the hilarious story of a businessman who hatches a wild plan to outsmart a gold-digging wife. The plot unfolds when the dislikable character arranges for his own kidnapping, only to find himself surrounded by a multitude of would-be thieves, all eager to get their hands on his significant fortune.

14. The Honeymooners (2005)

The Honeymooners” is a light-hearted comedy that follows the adventures of working-class New York bus driver, Ralph Kramden, who is always dreaming up new ways to make his fortune — often with the help of his best friend, Ed Norton. Together they navigate the city’s busy streets, facing countless mishaps and hilariously attempting to live out their fantasies.

15. The Elder Son (2006)

The Elder Son” is a unique blend of comedy and drama, set in the backdrop of Los Angeles with an intriguing Russian twist. The story revolves around an accomplished clarinetist, who is unexpectedly thrown into a whirlwind of emotions when a local car thief, pretending to be his long-lost son, crashes his peaceful life. The film promises a riveting exploration of identity, trust, and fate, all while weaving humor through the unpredictable interactions of the characters.

16. Scary Movie 4 (2006)

Scary Movie 4" is a comedic horror film released in 2006, which continues the hilarious exploits of Cindy Campbell. The movie features a mix of classic horror movie references and parodies, as Cindy discovers that her house is haunted by a murdered child. As she embarks on a quest to reveal the truth, she also battles against an alien invasion led by Tr-iPods.

17. First Sunday (2008)

First Sunday (2008) delivers a funny and entertaining cinematic experience, blending comedy, crime, and drama into one captivating film. With a runtime of 1 hour and 36 minutes and an IMDb rating of 4.6, this movie tells the story of two hapless, small-time criminals who embark on a foolhardy mission to rob a church. When they inadvertently arrive a day prior to their plan, they spend the night with the church staff in an effort to retrieve the stolen money.

18. Superhero Movie (2008)

The 2008 comedy film, Superhero Movie, follows the life of orphaned high school student Rick Riker, who becomes a superhero after being bitten by a radioactive dragonfly. Although he gains superpowers such as super strength and speed, Rick is unable to fly. As a hero, he takes on the responsibility of keeping his town safe from the evil clutches of Professor Charles Xavier, who seeks world domination with the help of his henchmen, including Storm and Wolverine.

22. Think Like a Man (2012)

Think Like a Man” is a heartwarming and hilarious romantic comedy featuring an all-star African American cast that explores the complexities of modern relationships. When four friends discover their partners have been utilizing relationship guru Steve Harvey’s advice against them, they devise a plan to turn the tables. Filled with humor, heart, and infectious chemistry, this movie will leave audiences laughing and rooting for the characters as they navigate love and self-discovery.

23. Walk On (2013)

Walk On” is a heartfelt and enlightening 2013 documentary film that tells the inspiring story of a disabled 21-year-old, born HIV positive, who takes on the challenge of training for an AIDS walk. As he educates others about HIV and disabilities, he forms an unlikely alliance with an amputee sprinter, a quadriplegic comic, and a Purple Heart veteran. Together, they explore the power of community, determination, and the human spirit.

24. The Best Man Holiday (2013)

The Best Man Holiday” is a heartwarming, laugh-out-loud comedy-drama film that brings its audience back in time to a Christmas reunion that stirs up old memories and rekindles long-forgotten relationships. After being separated for 15 years, college friends reunite for a holiday they will never forget. Filled with love, laughter, and surprising revelations, this movie takes the audience through a journey of self-discovery, friendship, and the power of love.

25. BET Awards 2013 (2013)

Entertainment meets empowerment as the 13th BET Awards, hosted by Chris Tucker, celebrates African-Americans in television, films, music, and sports. Held on June 30, 2013, at the Nokia Theatre in Los Angeles, this star-studded event aired on the Black Entertainment Television cable channel and showcased the achievements and excellence of these incredible entertainers. With an IMDb rating of 6.8, the night was filled with unforgettable moments and memorable performances that left the audience in awe.

26. About Last Night (2014)

About Last Night, “ the modern reimagining of David Mamet’s classic 1996 comedy, follows two sets of couples as they navigate through life’s ups and downs, from the first few drinks at the bar to the heat and passion in the bedroom. The film, set in Chicago, delves into the heart of sexual perversity and humor, featuring intertwining romantic storylines and the unexpected twists of fate that put each couple’s relationship to the test.

27. Think Like a Man Too (2014)

Think Like a Man Too” is a hilarious and heartwarming romantic comedy that brings back the lovable and clever couples from the original 2012 film, “Think Like a Man. “ This time, the action is set in Las Vegas, as the couples plan to celebrate a wedding amidst all the excitement of the city. However, things don’t go as they planned, as misadventures lead to unexpected and precarious situations that threaten to derail the big event.

28. BET Awards 2014 (2014)

Celebrate the triumphs and achievements of African Americans in television, films, music, and sports at the 14th BET Awards. Hosted by the versatile Chris Rock, this star-studded event was held on June 29, 2014, at the Nokia Theater in Los Angeles, California. Be sure to tune in as the BET Awards delves into the world of black music, television, and sports, airing on the Black Entertainment Television cable channel.

29. With This Ring (2015)

With This Ring” is a delightful blend of comedy and romance that follows the lives of three single women who make a pact to find their partners at a New Year’s Eve wedding. As the deadline approaches, each woman faces different challenges in their quest for love.

30. People Places Things (2015)

People Places Things” is a heartwarming, witty, and emotional comedy-drama that explores the complexities of love, parenthood, and the pursuit of happiness. Will Henry, played by Jemaine Clement, is a talented graphic novelist, now a single father to his twin daughters, navigating his way through the world of dating and a challenging teaching job. As he grapples with his midlife crisis, he learns to balance it all, all while dealing with past heartbreaks.

33. When the Bough Breaks (2016)

When the Bough Breaks” is a riveting 2016 drama-thriller that explores the complexities of surrogacy and the dark side of obsession. Directed by Jon Cassar and written by Jack Olsen, the film stars Morris Chestnut and Regina Hall as a couple who, desperate to expand their family, seek the help of a surrogate mother. However, their decision sets off a series of dangerous events that lead the surrogate down a twisted path of fixation with the soon-to-be father.

36. Barbershop: The Next Cut (2016)

Barbershop: The Next Cut is a heartwarming and humorous ensemble comedy-drama film that hits the sweet spot for viewers of all ages. Set in an urban neighborhood that has seen better days, the star-studded cast of Calvin’s Barbershop comes together, united in their quest to transform their community and restore hope to its residents.

37. VH1 Hip Hop Honors: The 90’s Game Changers (2017)

Immerse yourself in the vibrant world of Hip-Hop as VH1 presents ‘VH1 Hip Hop Honors: The 90’s Game Changers’ (2017), the ninth installment of the prestigious Hip-Hop Honors ceremony. Hosted by the talented Regina King, this unforgettable event pays tribute to the trailblazing artists, musicians, and cultural influencers who shaped the legacy of Hip-Hop in the “Old-School” and “Golden Age” eras. Prepare to be dazzled as the event takes place at the iconic Hammerstein Ballroom at Lincoln Center in New York City, promising a night to remember for both Hip-Hop fans and the stars of the genre.

38. Girls Trip (2017)

Experience the joy of sisterhood and the thrills of New Orleans in Girls Trip, a hilarious and heartwarming comedy-drama from 2017. When four longtime friends reunite for the bustling annual Essence Festival, they set off on a wild adventure filled with dancing, drinks, fights, and romantic encounters that will leave you laughing and cheering. Follow Regina Hall, Queen Latifah, and Jada Pinkett Smith as they navigate their way through the Big Easy, rediscovering their passion for life and each other.

39. Through the Fire: The Legacy of Barack Obama (2017)

Through the Fire: The Legacy of Barack Obama is a one-hour and ten-minute documentary that provides an in-depth look at the historic election of America’s first African-American president, Barack Obama, and his journey during his two-term presidency. This riveting film explores the political landscape and challenges faced by President Obama as he navigated his way through an election that would change the course of American history. With exclusive interviews from prominent political figures, such as Jesse Williams, Michele Bachmann, and Glenn Beck, the documentary offers a fresh perspective on the Obama era.

46. Shaft (2019)

In the 2019 reboot of the iconic original, “Shaft” tells the story of JJ Shaft, a cyber security expert with impressive credentials, yet finds himself entangled in an investigation that hits close to home. With the unexpected death of his best friend, JJ enlists the help of his family, including John “Shaft” Shaft, the legendary character played by Richard Roundtree.

47. Little (2019)

Little” is a comedy-fantasy that follows the life of a woman who gets stuck in her 13-year-old self after facing the stressors of adulthood. Set in the middle school world, this heartwarming film explores themes of body transformation and embracing one’s true self, all while delivering compelling portrayals of peer pressure and the challenges faced by African American and Black American women.

48. 50th NAACP Image Awards (2019)

Step onto the red carpet for the 50th NAACP Image Awards, a celebration of outstanding achievements across music, television, and film made by people of color in 2018. Hosted by Anthony Anderson and Kate Beckinsale, the live broadcast from the Dolby Theater in Hollywood, California, honors the year’s most remarkable successes in African American and black culture.

49. Breaking News in Yuba County (2021)

Breaking News in Yuba County is a crime comedy-drama film that premiered in 2021, written by Amanda Idoko and directed by Tate Taylor. This movie boasts an impressive cast, including Allison Janney, Mila Kunis, and Regina Hall. Set in the town of Yuba County, the film follows a woman who takes full advantage of her growing celebrity status when she is left to believe her husband has gone missing. Little does she know that there’s more to the story than meets the eye.

50. Gonzo Girl (2023)

Gonzo Girl, directed by Patricia Arquette, tells the story of a talented yet struggling young writer who takes up a challenging job, working as an assistant to a renowned yet wild novelist. As she delves deeper into the world of literature and the enigmatic figure she is assisting, a series of unexpected events unfold that force her to confront her ambitions, beliefs, and the complexities of human nature.
